snippet.textDisplay:
In 2008, due to Beijing hosting the Olympics, the city got a facelift, dilapidated traditional Hutong alley and old neighborhoods were refurbished to their former glory.
Subways were built, and many community sports facilities and parks were built as well. The quality of life in Beijing increased considerably
2022 Olympics saw investment going in Winter sports industries and Ski resorts, this would encourage people to be even more active during the cold winters
It will also boost the economy in the long run through sports entertainment industries. Just think of the many Chinese buying Winter sports gears, and how much demand it would generate

This is why vast majority of Chinese loves the Olympics and supports hosting them, because the government has a strategic long term plan for each Olympic and it genuinely benefits the country.
Not every country can claim the same, the 2004 Athens Olympics made the debt problem in Greece even worse, and the venues were abandoned, similar problem existed for the Rio 2016 Olympics

So you really need a competent government to host the Olympics properly.

snippet.textDisplay: The statistical data show that from 2010 to 2018, the population of ethnic minorities and that of the Uygurs in Xinjiang has witnessed steady growth, while that of the Han ethnic group in Xinjiang has slightly increased. In terms of population size, from 2010 to 2018, the permanent resident population of Xinjiang increased from 21.8158 million to 24.8676 million, an increase of 3.0518 million, or 13.99%. Among them, the population of ethnic minorities increased from 12.9859 million to 15.8608 million, an increase of 2.8749 million, or 22.14%; from the perspective of ethnic groups, the Uygur population increased from 10.1715 million to 12.7184 million, an increase of 2.5469 million, or 25.04%; the population of Han ethnic group increased from 8.8299 million to 9.0068 million, an increase of 176,900 people, or 2.0%. The growth rate of the Uygur population is higher than not only that of the region in total, but also that of other ethnic minorities, and is obviously much higher than that of the Han population.
snippet.textOriginal: The statistical data show that from 2010 to 2018, the population of ethnic minorities and that of the Uygurs in Xinjiang has witnessed steady growth, while that of the Han ethnic group in Xinjiang has slightly increased. In terms of population size, from 2010 to 2018, the permanent resident population of Xinjiang increased from 21.8158 million to 24.8676 million, an increase of 3.0518 million, or 13.99%. Among them, the population of ethnic minorities increased from 12.9859 million to 15.8608 million, an increase of 2.8749 million, or 22.14%; from the perspective of ethnic groups, the Uygur population increased from 10.1715 million to 12.7184 million, an increase of 2.5469 million, or 25.04%; the population of Han ethnic group increased from 8.8299 million to 9.0068 million, an increase of 176,900 people, or 2.0%. The growth rate of the Uygur population is higher than not only that of the region in total, but also that of other ethnic minorities, and is obviously much higher than that of the Han population.

snippet.textDisplay: @TheAlexandre Debt in terms of monetary value is only as valuable as trust. Resources is resources. Even without Monetary value its still resources. Take for example Australia selling raw iron ore to China for refinement. A majority of these metals are in China and will stay in China due to the huge domestic market. All China had to give up is an arbritrary monetary value which is gained by selling refined and manufactured goods from said raw resources back to Australia. Australia cannot compete with the large market nor can it compete with the manufacturing & refining capability of China. Thus, It will not make sense for Australia to refine or manufacture goods out of these raw resources due to the profit margins and its puny domestic market. Thus, In this case, Australia had to give up resources, and to buy refined resources from China using DEBT. So who is actually profitting? Can Australia rebuy all the Raw Ores sold to China? or is it forced to buy goods manufactured in China made using its own resources? Like i said before, you need to look broader to understand what debt really is. Buying resources will inevitably incur massive amounts of debts, so will investing in infrastructure, amenities and so on. In turn, It allows for the market to turn, more spending, larger economic activity with an inclusive middle class. Which turns the wheel and more allow debt to occur. If the System is stable, It can keep turning forever, When its not, these large hegemons can wipe off its own debt and profit off this dependent relationship with other nations. But one thing for certain, they are not afraid of DEBT becasue inherantly it does not really affect these massive powers, its just a tool. Resources is what they want and really cherish.
